Description:
Solid Cream Brick in the Heart of Kennington
As solid as they come is this 14 square cream bricker right in the heart of Kennington. Set on a large 864m2 allotment this property opens itself up to a wide variety of buyers.
Comprising of:-
-4 generous bedroom, 3 with BIR
-Large lounge
-Family bathroom
-Well-appointed kitchen
-Polished floorboards in entry and hallway
-High ceilings
-Shedding x 2
-Direct access to huge rear yard
An opportunity to invest or to get into the ever growing Bendigo market at an entry level price in one of Bendigo's premier suburbs. Public transport, schools, shops and hotels right on your doorstep. A must to inspect at this price.
Bec Allen : 0438 528 091

Description:
Low Maintenance Living in Prime Location!
Perfectly positioned in an impressive location is this immaculate townhouse with so much to offer being within walking distance to abundant amenities including Strath Village, Drs Surgeries/Pharmacies, the Kennington Village Shopping Precinct, & the tranquil setting of the Kennington Reservoir. You will be impressed from front to back with this property including high ceilings, large windows, 3 bedrooms-main with walk in robe & ensuite, large light filled lounge room, well-equipped kitchen with gas/electric cooking & dishwasher overlooking the private backyard, separate dining room & a double garage with automatic roller door. Living the relaxed lifestyle is easy here thanks to the low maintenance & private yard, sit and relax under the rear alfresco area and listen to the bird life or your children play.

Description:
Investors, First Homebuyers – Jewel in the Rough!
With a magnificent central location this home offers great opportunity to maximize return for the investor; or for the first home buyer, renovate and enjoy the convenience of surrounding services. A flexible floor-plan, currently 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, formal lounge, and large second living area the home is surprisingly spacious. Outside includes a double carport and garden shed with fully enclosed rear yard. With plenty of scope to improve the property, and a flexible floor plan this home represents excellent opportunity to improve the rental return. Only minutes walk to the CBD, Train Station and the Latrobe University the position is highly sought after. Don't delay, will not last.

Description:
Luxurious Living In A Premium Location
Situated in a premium location within walking distance to Kennington Village, schools, public transport and the Kennington Reservoir, this stunning three bedroom, two bathroom townhouse will impress the most discerning purchaser.Featuring quality fixtures and fittings throughout, the home offers luxurious and light-filled living with two sparkling bathrooms, spacious kitchen/living/dining area flowing seamlessly to the undercover alfresco area, ducted heating and cooling and so much more.Excellent utilisation of space has created ample storage options, separate toilet and a large double garage with automatic roller door and direct-entry into the home.Externally, the property is landscaped and fenced securely, which adds even more appeal to the lucky new owner. Suiting a wide range of buyers including owner-occupiers, investors or retirees offering a first class home in a top location. Unit 2 is also available for purchase

Description:
Fantastic Investment Potential ? Ideal Location!
With solid foundations and a private quiet court front is this spacious three bedroom home overlooking the park & playground, this really is this is an opportunity not to be missed!
Comprising of three great sized bedrooms, two with built in robes this property makes for a great investment. On offer is also a fantastic light filled kitchen with gas cooking and an abundance of storage, an open plan dining area flowing through to the large lounge room with gas heating and air-conditioning. This space is an extremely generous size and offers great potential.
The central bathroom includes a bath and separate shower and the toilet and laundry are also separately located.
Outdoors the spacious and enclosed yard offers a great lockable shed with power and a roller door, a garden shed and a carport This property is located just off St Adians Road, only a short walk to the Bendigo CBD and all Kennington amenities, schools and transportation. Contact the agent today to arrange your inspection!

Description:
Location and Low Maintenance - move in and enjoy
This attractive townhouse is more like a home inside. Approx 12 months old, it is very well-established amongst homes and in an area that always proves popular to invest and move into.
Set amongst landscaped grounds, stonewashed drives and paths, the home is within the most desired of locations, ideal for first home buyers, professionals, small families and retirees.
The open-plan living is filled with light and leads to a sunny, concreted alfresco area. Covered in floating timber floorboards gives that natural feel and look. Beyond the huge breakfast bar, the kitchen is well-appointed with stainless-steel appliances including a dishwasher.
The master bedroom incorporates a spacious ensuite with built-in robes and feature window shutters, while the 2 other bedrooms contain built-in robes with ceiling fans, and are serviced by a 3 piece bathroom with separate toilet. Great storage throughout, and ducted gas heating and cooling, convenient for all seasons.
An oversized double garage with automatic roller door gives direct internal access into the home. A short walk to shopping centres, medical facilities, schools, university, gym, bus to CBD and Kennington Reservoir. One to mark down to inspect.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
A winner for retirees
No need to have a bet on the cup, this property already has the winning trifecta of location, convenience and comfort.
Located in a plum position just 300 metres from all facilities including supermarkets, bank, post office, medical practice, pharmacy, bakery, cafes, gym and the ever-popular walking paths around Kennington Reservoir.
But wait, there's more good news â?? there's no need to cramp your style in retirement. The home has four good-sized bedrooms, two bathrooms, separate lounge with gas log fire and spacious open-plan living, dining and kitchen spaces opening to a covered alfresco area. Extras include space-enhancing higher ceilings, gas heating plus split system air conditioning, electric cooking, dishwasher, pantry, ample storage and direct internal access from the garage with remote door.
A full-length front verandah overlooks well-tended front gardens featuring roses and flowering shrubs behind manicured hedges or enjoy a little backyard bounty from a variety of fruit trees in the rear garden.
Set in a quiet culdesac, the corner allotment (approximately 626 mÂ²) has extra off-street parking and double-gated access to the back yard for parking trailers etc.
It's a recipe for retirement with the perfect mix of position, layout and lifestyle.

Description:
Neat, sweet and complete Kennington charmer
A perfect example of the 1950's dwellings, this property has been impeccably maintained and updated with recent partial re stumping making it ready for immediate occupation.
The weatherboard and tile roof construction has all the hallmarks of the era including pergola-covered front patio, tapestry brick fireplace with gas heater in the lounge and high ceilings and picture rails throughout.
It offers a spacious entry hall, three bedrooms (two with built-in robes and dressing tables),a light-filled lounge room and gas ducted heating and evaporative cooling. The important areas of kitchen and bathroom have been renovated with the kitchen now providing plenty of white cabinetry, Westinghouse cooking appliances and a convenient island breakfast bar separating it from the dining area.
Outside is single carport and full-length rear verandah overlooking the very private and secure back garden complete with rainwater tank, electric pump and drip irrigation system.
Located in a prime Kennington position on approximately 660 square metres of land, this is an ideal choice for first home buyers, retirees or investors.
The home has gas ducted heating, evaporative cooling, a rainwater tank with an electric pump and drip irrigation system.

Description:
VIEWS TO CATHEDRAL & WALK TO UNI
This beautifully presented and elevated 1960s cream BV home offers views over Bendigo. From the front balcony you can see the Bendigo city vista and cathedral spire. You can conveniently walk around the corner to La Trobe Uni, Brennan Park Pool and Strath Hill shopping centres. Each of the three bedrooms offers BIRs, ceiling fans and plenty of light. The freshly painted home, with newly polished floorboards throughout, also has an upgraded kitchen with granite bench tops and plenty of cupboards. The grey stacked brick fireplace is a feature of the light and airy L-shaped lounge /dining room. Polished wooden doors, architraves and pelmets add warmth to the home. Gas heating and an air conditioner maintain year round comfort. Outside, the low maintenance garden has plenty of room (900sq m) for extensions to the house or for a keen gardener to work their magic. The elevated house provides a carport for the car, drive-through access to the backyard and there is roomy under-house storage. Don't delay in contacting our agency to inspect this solid affordable home in a great location with views to die for.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO DOWNSIZE
All that you dreamed of is here in this delightful townhouse that combines space and harmony.
Inside is a real surprise package, separate entrance, high ceilings to the three double bedrooms with main with ensuite and walk in robe.
- Kitchen works well and incorporates the dining, family room, this room overlooks the open park type lands at the rear which is north facing.
- Formal lounge also north facing has a cosy split system supplemented by the ducted gas heating thru the home
- Two separate bedrooms with BIRs and split systems
are serviced by the family bathroom .
- Step out from the family room to the sunny patio and enjoy breakfast overlooking the bush.
- Direct access from patio to double garage
- The owner has built an amazing train set in the garage and this could be negotiable to the new buyer
- Low maintenance garden but big enough to enjoy.
- These properties so close to the popular Kennington shopping precinct do not come up very
often so we are excited to open this townhouse up for sale
- Go shopping, walk around the Kennington reservoir, catch the bus to town , do a course at the Uni
so many possibilities ....
A new lifestyle awaits you.
Helen Ashby : 0408 42 5566

Description:
Neat Brick Veneer in Popular Area
Situated on a good size block this comfortable three bedroom house has everything you need. Of brick veneer and tiled roof construction the home has been well maintained and cared for. It has been freshly painted internally, in neutral tones, which make it bright and airy throughout.
The three generous bedrooms, all at the back of the house, have built in robes which feature new timber doors. The lounge room is a good size (5.9 x 4.5m) and has a gas wall heater. The lounge opens into the meals area which then flows into the galley style kitchen. The kitchen has a gas stove, large pantry and breakfast bar with overhead glass display cupboard. The wet areas are cleverly designed down this side of the house with the laundry and external door accessible from the kitchen. There is a pristine three piece family bathroom centrally located between the three bedrooms and a separate toilet.
Outside there are immaculate gardens and expanses of lawn. Undercover parking is available with a single carport attached to the house but there is also the advantage of a separate concrete driveway leading to a 6x4m galvanised shed with power and concrete that could be another garage or workshop. There is also a 1m x1.5 galvanised garden shed with concrete floor.
Kennington itself is a popular area with access to the CBD, primary and secondary schools, recreation and medical facilities and plenty of shopping.
Overall, this home will appeal to a variety of buyers- investors, first home buyers or retirees.
Greg Coghill : 0428 500 633

Description:
Everything at your Doorstep Develop Right Here
In the heart of Kennington, this three-bedroom home is within close proximity of the McIvor Highway, Bendigo central business district, public transport, schools and parklands and so much more. The home is in need of a complete makeover. Or take advantage of the location, size of the block, and develop it to your liking all subject to council approval. The 1960s style home has three bedrooms, one bathroom, open kitchen dining, separate compact kitchen, polished Baltic Pine boards throughout, single carport, separate workshop. This blank canvass is ready for your plans and design skills. Ideal for a first homebuyer, developers or downsizers willing to do the work in such a great central location, will you be the one to reap the rewards?

Description:
EXCELLENT LOCATION AT A VERY AFFORDABLE PRICE
Your opportunity has arrived to buy or invest into one of Bendigo's most sought after suburbs, so you had better act quickly to avoid disappointment! Nestled at the rear of the complex is this two bedroom unit, conveniently located close to all major amenities, with the CBD of Bendigo less than 2Km and La Trobe Uni 3Km away, the unit is ideally suited to (but not restricted to) students, retirees, singles, couples and investors alike.
The property is presented in original condition and in very good order throughout â?? occupy now or rent out as is and reap the rewards of a very affordable investment. The floor plan consists of two carpeted bedrooms; both fitted with built in robes, the larger of the two has its own air conditioner. The open plan kitchen/dining/ and living space is at the heart of the home with the kitchen having electric oven and cooktop; the living room is spacious enough for a unit, with room for a dining table. Another air conditioner and heater take care of the climate control.
Outside is a low maintenance yard with a garden shed for storage and further storage is provided by an external 2 door cupboard. A single carport at the front offers secure off street parking.
A very comfy, cosy and affordable proposition for the home seeker or investor in a fabulous location. Currently let to excellent long term tenants at $220 per week.

Description:
POSITION, POSITION - INVEST OR NEST!!
Situated in close proximity to Strath Hill & Strath Village shopping centers, La Trobe uni, primary schools, doctors etc., this very neat home, with a generous open plan kitchen/meals/living area, is all set to move in to or rent out. The single garage has internal access and power.There are built-in-robes in all of the bedrooms, with a three piece 2-way bathroom off the main. A new gas ducted heating system and ducted evaporative air-conditioning are more than adequate to ensure a comfy internal environment. The home is sited on a tidy, fully fenced compact block, requiring very little upkeep. Enjoy the many benefits the location offers including being a short walk to the city through the delightful Harry Trott recreation reserve. Expected rental is $260 to $270 per week, and vacant possession is available.

Description:
LOOK AT ME...
A wonderful opportunity to secure this delightful two bedroom brick veneer townhouse in a quiet spot in Kennington. Builder: Mark Waters.
Includes formal tiled entry, large master bedroom with built in robes and has access to the bathroom. Second bedroom offers built in robes as well. Light open plan living/dining/kitchen. The kitchen offers gas hotplates, gas wall oven, double pantry, great storage and breakfast bar.
The lovely tiled family bathroom provides separate bath and shower. Extras include: new gas wall furnace and ceiling fans. A real bonus being newly painted and carpeted throughout in soft neutral tonings. Single garage with roller door. Totally relax under the elevated rear veranda overlooking a private back garden.
Location is a real winner being close to Strathdale's shopping complexes, University, schools and transport.
An immaculate home or an ideal investment property. Don't miss this one!
Di Long : 0417 343 380

Description:
EXCLUSIVE EASY CARE VILLA UNIT
Resting in a tranquil boutique complex, this unit would be an ideal fit for the savvy professional, downsizer looking to enjoy a low maintenance lifestyle, or investor after a solid, readymade investment with an excellent, already established tenant who would like to stay on. Comprising spacious open living with bay window adjacent to meals and functional, well-appointed kitchen. Master bedroom features sunny bay window and triple robe space, there's a good sized second robed bedroom, plus additional room at the rear of the garage suitable for a multitude of uses including a guest bedroom, office, gym or playroom for the kids. The bathroom is huge with generous amounts of cupboard space, separate laundry conveniently located adjacent to the kitchen also includes valuable storage. Outdoors features intimate rear terrace, quaint front garden complete with grand palm tree, shady bull nosed verandah and single garage with access directly inside. Benefits include gas heating and refrigerated air conditioning complimented by lovely decorative cornices and intricate ceiling roses. An easy walk to Schools, University, shops and Cafe's, this is a truly idyllic setting boasting convenience and facilities at your doorstep.
Insights: 1/26 Hodgkinson Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2016 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Sought After Position for Family Living
Superbly appointed & impeccably presented, this lovely home has been fully renovated with family & entertaining in mind. There is a formal lounge, plus the open plan, dining & kitchen area with all new appliances & large walk in pantry with the addition of a clever study space off to one side. Enter the outside entertainment area to find the undercover alfresco & a beautiful 8x4m in ground heated pool, finished with clear glass fencing, which is perfectly situated within the well maintained garden. There are 4 large bedrooms (the main includes BIRs and ensuite), the remaining 3 are of good size, with BIRs & have access to the family bathroom & separate toilet. An added bonus is the large multi-functional rumpus/games room. External features include a single remote garage, single carport, a rainwater storage tank as well as a 3kw solar system allowing for minimal power bills. Situated on a 761m2 block (approx.), in a prime location close to Kennington Reservoir, Strath Village Shopping Centre & within easy walking distance to Kennington schools, colleges, Bendigo Park recreational facilities, this elegant home ensures a high quality lifestyle.
Insights: 4 Willow Drive, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
The address says it all
Unlike it's namesake, the busy London thoroughfare, Bendigo's version of The Strand is a quiet, sleepy street conveniently located between the city and Strath Village.
Established in the seventies, homes in the area have eternal appeal and this one is no exception.
Held by the same owner for the past 27 years, it oozes charm, comfort and convenience and has been meticulously maintained and updated inside and out.
Features include a welcoming entry hall leading to three robed bedrooms (main with ensuite), spacious lounge and dining rooms with gas heating and split system air conditioning. Large main bathroom, ample storage options and a well-appointed solid timber kitchen and adjoining meals area opening to a sun-drenched and vine-covered alfresco deck. Enjoy Sunday brunch overlooking paved sitting nooks and the delightful established gardens where sprigs of spring are beginning to show. A double carport, garden shed and rainwater tank complete the outside.
One of Bendigo's premier locations, the prestigious pocket is close enough to walk to Coles supermarket, pharmacy, doctor and public transport with Strath Village and the CBD a short drive away.
With a classical past and a promising future, the property has perfect potential for young couples, investors or golden oldies looking for a golden lifestyle. Call for an inspection today.
Insights: 10 The Strand, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2017 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
"Maison Blanche" One to Admire
Sitting pretty and very authentic in many ways is “Maison Blanche”, a 3 bedroom Californian Bungalow in a prime location off McIvor Road in Kennington.
The moment you step forward through the gates you are greeted with red brick paths, inviting gardens and front timber verandah with traditional solid lacework ornate posts.
Through the double glass doors you enter the open lounge with polished hardwood floors, open fire place and mantle, plus there is a variety of decorative cornices and ceiling domes.
Main bedroom with frosted glass doors, walk-in robe and led light windows.
The other two great sized bedrooms also offer hanging shelves, fixed desks and space.
The eye-catching timber kitchen has the original combustion stove fitted and mod-cons including stainless steel gas hot plates and electric stove, with galley-style fixed bench seating and table.
Ducted heating throughout and 2 split system units for year round comfort.
The multipurpose room incorporates a study, and overlooks the secure yard through double glass doors, with views of the undercover entertaining area.
The 4 piece bathroom has been updated in the past.
Outside finds a double garage, and you can entertain family and friends on the deck.
Huge location with hot spot amenities close by.
Schools, Post Office, Coles, public transport, vets and medical clinics are within walking distance, with Bendigo Central, Lake Weeroona and the new hospital just minutes' drive away.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321
Insights: 7 Patrick Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2016 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.
